sen.e: Japan Freight Railway Company became the first class railway operator of the Yokkaichi-Shiohama section (3.3km) and the Hirano-Kudara section (1.4km), and it also became the second class railway operator of the Nagoya-Kameyama section (59.9km), the Kizu-Shinimamiya section (45.5km) and the Ryuge Signal Station-Sugimotocho section (10.5km).

sen.j: JR難波はかつて「湊町」という駅名だったが、1994年に改称され、1996年に地下化された。
sen.e: The JR Namba Staion was called "Minatomachi" in the past, but it was renamed in 1994 and became the underground station in 1996.
JR Namba Station was called "Minatomachi" in the past, but it was renamed in 1994 and became an underground station in 1996.

sen.j: 駅は2面4線の構造になっている。
sen.e: This station has two platforms and four tracks.
This station has two platforms and four tracks.

sen.j: この駅では大阪市営地下鉄大阪市営地下鉄千日前線や御堂筋線・大阪市営地下鉄四つ橋線、近畿日本鉄道、阪神電気鉄道、南海電気鉄道と連絡している。
sen.e: At this station, the line connects with the Sennichimae Line of Osaka Municipal Subway, the Yotsubashi Line of Osaka Municipal Subway, Kinki-Nippon Railway, Hanshin Electric Railway and Nankai Electric Railway.

sen.j: しかし、各線とも遠く、一番近い地下鉄四つ橋線でも乗り換えは便利とはいえない。
sen.e: However, all the above lines are located a little far from this station and the transfer is not so convenient even in the case of the Yotsubashi Line of Osaka Municipal Subway, which is the nearest one.

sen.j: 駅の直上は大阪シティエアターミナルがあり、大阪国際空港や関西国際空港へのリムジンバスや各地への高速バスのターミナルとして機能している。
sen.e: Osaka City Air Terminal, a terminal of limousines bound for the Osaka International Airport and the Kansai International Airport as well as express buses bound for various places, is located above the station,

sen.j: また駅周辺では超高層マンションが建ち並び、再開発が急速に進展している。
sen.e: As the surrounding area has been redeveloped rapidly, many skyscraper condos are standing side by side near the station.

sen.j: かつて関西本線と阪和線を結ぶ連絡線として通称「阪和貨物線」「阪和連絡線」と呼ばれる八尾駅 - 杉本町駅間の支線があり、JR西日本の旅客営業キロ11.3kmが設定されていた（八尾 - 久宝寺間は本線と重複で実際は久宝寺 - 加美間から分岐）。
sen.e: In the past, there was a branch line runnuing between the Yao Station and the Sugimotocho Station, which connected the Kansai Main Line with the Hanwa Line and was commonly called "Hanwa Freight Line" or "Hanwa Connecting Line", and JR West set passenger business kilometers of 11.3km (trains ran on the main line between Yao and Kyuhoji and this line actually diverged at the point between Kyuhoji and Kami).

In the past, there was a branch line running between Yao Sugimotocho Stations, that connected the Kansai Main Line with the Hanwa Line and was commonly called the "Hanwa Freight Line" or "Hanwa Connecting Line," and JR West set passenger business kilometers of 11.3km (trains ran on the main line between Yao and Kyuhoji and this line actually diverged at the point between Kyuhoji and Kami).

sen.j: この連絡線を経由して臨時列車や団体専用列車が運転された。
sen.e: Using this connecting line, special trains and trains exclusive for group passengers were operated.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Using this connecting line, special trains and trains exclusive for groups passengers were operated.

sen.j: また、国鉄時代の1965年から1967年までには定期列車として名古屋 - 東和歌山（現・和歌山）間を結ぶ特急「かすが (列車)」が設定されていたこともあった。
sen.e: Also, Limited Express "Kasuga" was operated between Nagoya and Higashi-Wakayama (current Wakayama) as a regular train during the period from 1965 to 1967, the era of JNR.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Also, Limited Express "Kasuga" operated between Nagoya and Higashi-Wakayama (current Wakayama) as a regular train during the period from 1965 to 1967, the era of JNR.

sen.j: しかし、本来の用途は貨物線であったため、前述の通称がある。
sen.e: However, this line was commonly called by the above-mentioned name because its original purpose was freight service.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: However, this line was commonly called by the above-mentioned name because its original purpose was freight service.

sen.j: 一時は杉本町から先の延伸計画もあり、北島に操車場 (鉄道)、さらに住之江から大阪港と堺市大浜への貨客線の建設計画（阪和貨物線の旅客線化を含む）もあったが、国鉄の財政難のため実現しなかった。
sen.e: There were plans to extend the line beyond Sugimotocho, to construct a track yard (railway) at Kitajima and to construct freight & passenger line from Suminoe to Osakako and Ohama in Sakai City (including a plan to convert the Hanwa Freight line into a freight & passenger line), but none of them were materialized because of the financial difficulties of JNR.

There were plans to extend the line beyond Sugimotocho, to construct a track yard (railway) at Kitajima and to construct a freight & passenger line from Suminoe to Osakako and Ohama in Sakai City (including a plan to convert the Hanwa Freight line into a freight & passenger line), but none of them materialized because of financial difficulties of JNR.

There were plans to extend the line beyond Sugimotocho, to construct a track yard (railway) at Kitajima and to construct a freight & passenger line from Suminoe to Osakako and Ohama in Sakai City (including a plan to convert the Hanwa Freight line into a freight & passenger line), but none of them materialized because of financial difficulties of JNR.

sen.j: JR移行後はもっぱら南海電気鉄道向け車両の甲種輸送に使用されていた。
sen.e: After the launch of JR, the line was used almost exclusively for Ko-shu railway transport of cars delivered to Nankai Railway Company.
After the launch of JR, the line was used almost exclusively for Ko-shu railway transport of cars delivered to Nankai Railway Company.
After the launch of JR, the line was used almost exclusively for Ko-shu railway transport of cars delivered to Nankai Railway Company.

sen.j: 甲種輸送の性格上、路線の使用頻度は低かったが、線路保守のために錆取り列車が王寺 - 鳳駅間で運転されていた。
sen.e: As the line was used with low frequency due to the nature of Ko-shu raiway transport, sabitori-ressha was operated between the Oji Station and the Otori Station.
As the line was used at a low frequency due to the nature of Ko-shu raiway transport, sabitori-ressha operated between Oji and the Otori Stations.

sen.j: 納入ルートが変更されるとJR貨物による免許は2003年4月1日に廃止となった。
sen.e: After the delivery route of cars was changed, the license granted to JR Freight was cancelled as of April 1, 2003.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: After the delivery route for automobiles was changed, the license granted to JR Freight was cancelled as of April 1, 2003.
After the delivery route for automobiles was changed, the license granted to JR Freight was cancelled as of April 1, 2003.

sen.j: その後もJR西日本によって路線は保持されたものの、国土交通省による大和川の改修事業やおおさか東線建設工事の支障になることなどを理由に2004年6月末で休止され、関西本線からの接続部が撤去された。
sen.e: Although the line was maintained by JR West thereafter, its operation was suspended and the joint with the Kansai Main Line was removed at the end of June 2004 on the ground that the line could become the obstacle for the repair work of Yamato-gawa River by the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism as well as the construction work of the Osaka-higashi Line.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Although the line was maintained by JR West thereafter, its operations were suspended and the joint with the Kansai Main Line was removed at the end of June 2004 on the grounds that the line could become an obstacle for repair work at the Yamato-gawa River by the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism as well as for construction work on the Osaka-higashi Line.

Although the line was maintained by JR West thereafter, its operations were suspended and the joint with the Kansai Main Line was removed at the end of June 2004 on the grounds that the line could become an obstacle for repair work at the Yamato-gawa River by the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism as well as for construction work on the Osaka-higashi Line.

sen.j: 結局、2008年3月に天王寺駅構内の阪和線と大和路線を結ぶ構内短絡線が増設されたことにより使用されなくなることから、2008年11月17日にJR西日本が第1種鉄道事業の廃止届出を行った。
sen.e: Finally, JR West applied for the cancellation of first class railway operator license on November 17, 2008 on the ground that it no more needed the line since a new line connecting the Hanwa Line and the Yamatoji Line was completed inside the Tenoji Station's premises.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Finally, JR West applied for the cancellation of the first class railway operator's license on November 17, 2008 on the grounds that it no longer needed the line since a new line connecting the Hanwa and Yamatoji Lines was completed inside Tenoji Station's premises.

sen.j: その後廃止日の繰り上げが認められたため、2009年3月31日付で廃止となった。
sen.e: Thereafter, the line was formally abolished as of March 31, 2009 when it was approved to bring forward the date of abolition.

tit.j: 亀山 - 加茂間の電化促進同盟
tit.e: Association for promoting the electrification of Kameyama-Kamo section
Association for promoting the electrification of the Kameyama-Kamo section
Association for promoting the electrification of the Kameyama-Kamo section

sen.j: 閑散区間である亀山駅 (三重県) - 加茂駅 (京都府)の間を電化し、大阪や名古屋まで電車を直通させてはどうかという声があり、沿線の自治体は「関西本線奈良亀山間複線電化促進同盟」などの団体を結成してこの区間の電化を要望している。
sen.e: In response to voices requesting to electrify the Kameyama Station (Mie Prefecture)-Kamo Station (Kyoto Prefecture) section and operate direct trains to Osaka/Nagoya, municipal governments along the line are requesting the electrification of this section by organizing "Association for promoting double-track and electrification of the Kansai Main Line's Nara-Kameyama section" etc..
sen.cmt: 関西本線奈良亀山間複線電化促進同盟→定訳不明

sen.j: 電化によって通勤や移動が便利になり、笠置駅や伊賀上野駅、関駅 (三重県)では新たな観光需要が生まれることも期待されている。
sen.e: By electrifying the line, residents' commuting and travelling become more convenient and the increase of tourists can be expected for the Kasagi Station, Iga-Ueno Station and Seki Station.
By electrifying the line, residents' commuting and travelling can enjoy more conveniece and the increase of tourists can be expected for Kasagi Station, Iga-Ueno Station and Seki Station.

By electrifying the line, residents' commuting and travelling can enjoy more convenience and the increase of tourists can be expected for Kasagi Station, Iga-Ueno Station and Seki Station (Mie Prefecture).

sen.j: 沿線の自治体には電化費用捻出のための募金箱も設置されている。
sen.e: Donation boxes are set at municipal offices along the line in order to collect funds for electrification.
Donation boxes are set at municipal offices along the line in order to collect funds for electrification.
Donation boxes are set at municipal offices along the line in order to collect funds for electrification.

sen.j: 一方で、この区間は通行料不要の名阪国道も並行しており、この区間にある伊賀市からは伊賀鉄道伊賀線や大阪・名古屋への高速バスも走っていることから、あえて地元が資金を負担してまで電化する理由を見いだせないのではないか、との意見も多い。
sen.e: On the other hand, not a few people argue that there is no reason to promote the electrification while sharing the construction cost on the ground that the Meihan National Route, which is free of fare, runs side by side with the line and the Iga Line of Iga Railway Company as well as highway buses are being operated from Iga City, which is located in this section, to Osaka/Nagoya.

On the other hand, not a few people argue that there is no reason to promote electrification while sharing the construction cost on the grounds that the Meihan National Route, which is free of fare, runs side by side with the line and the Iga Line of Iga Railway Company as well as highway buses are being operated from Iga City, which is located in this section, to Osaka/Nagoya.

On the other hand, not a few people argue that there is no reason to promote electrification while sharing the construction cost on the grounds that the Meihan National Route, which is free of fare, runs side by side with the line and the Iga Line of Iga Railway Company as well as highway buses are being operated from Iga City, which is located in this section, to Osaka/Nagoya.

sen.j: 加えて、同区間の電化に対する関心はきわめて薄い。
sen.e: In addition, residents have little interest in the electrification of this section.
In addition, residents have little interest in the electrification of this section.
In addition, residents have little interest in the electrification of this section.

sen.j: また、観光需要を見いだせるとされる駅の周辺も歴史に縁があったり古い町並みが残ってはいるが、長浜市の黒壁スクエアのような観光地としての整備が不十分で、現状のままでは電化しても新たな観光需要は生まれない、とされる（長浜が成功したのも観光地としての徹底した整備が主因であり、京阪神からの新快速が直通したことは間接的影響に過ぎない）。
sen.e: Further, it is said that although historical spots or old streets are located in the surrounding area of stations that are expected to attract tourists, these areas are not well-prepared for tourist spots, unlike Kurokabe Square in Nagahama City, and new tourism demands may not be created by electrifying the line under the current situation (the main reason for Nagahama's success was its efforts as a tourist spot and direct running of Special Rapid from Keihanshin (Kyoto, Osaka and Kobe) contributed only indirectly).

Further, it is said that although historical spots or old streets are located in the surrounding area of stations that are expected to attract tourists, these areas are not well-prepared as tourist spots, unlike Kurokabe Square in Nagahama City, and new tourism demands may not be created by electrifying the line under the current situation (the main reason for Nagahama's success was its efforts as a tourist spot and direct running of Special Rapid from Keihanshin (Kyoto, Osaka and Kobe) contributed only indirectly).
